events.description: The release of retail sales data for the Czech Republic for December 2025, showing a significant slowdown in growth.

facts.fact_text: Retail sales in the Czech Republic rose by 1.8% year-on-year in December 2025.

evidences.evidence_text: Retail sales in the Czech Republic rose by 1.8% year-on-year in December 2025

facts.fact_text: The retail sales growth of 1.8% was lower than the market forecast of 3.5%.

evidences.evidence_text: sharply lower than market forecasts of a 3.5% gain

facts.fact_text: Retail sales growth in the previous month was revised to 4.5%.

evidences.evidence_text: slowing from a downwardly revised and five-month high of 4.5% increase in the previous month

facts.fact_text: On a seasonally adjusted monthly basis, retail trade fell by 0.1% in December.

evidences.evidence_text: On a seasonally adjusted monthly basis, retail trade fell by 0.1% in December

claims.claim_text: The slowdown in retail sales was primarily driven by weaker performance in the non-food product sector.

evidences.evidence_text: driven by softer sales increase for non-food products (2% vs 6.3% in November)

claims.claim_text: Activity growth slowed for automotive fuel and food, beverages, and tobacco.

evidences.evidence_text: Additionally, activity growth slowed for automotive fuel (3.9% vs 6%) and food, beverages, and tobacco (1% vs 1.1%)

evidence.evidence_text: Retail sales in the Czech Republic rose by 1.8% year-on-year in December 2025... slowing from a downwardly revised and five-month high of 4.5% increase
driven by softer sales increase for non-food products (2% vs 6.3% in November)
